issues.description: Incorrect error type check in DeleteIdentityProviderCfg - checks for openid.ErrProviderConfigNotFound in LDAP code path instead of cfgldap.ErrProviderConfigNotFound
Potential security issue in AddServiceAccountLDAP where error handling depends on string matching that might be bypassed if error message format changes
Missing error check after proxyDecommissionRequest call in StartDecommission, which could lead to silent failures
Missing error handling after purgeDeletedBucket call in SRPeerBucketOps, potentially ignoring critical errors
Inconsistent error logging in SiteReplicationDevNull that may hide important network errors
Security vulnerability in AddServiceAccount where empty requestorParentUser is checked but not properly handled
Insufficient policy validation in UpdateServiceAccount where policy is parsed but not thoroughly validated
Race condition in ServerUpdateV2Handler when updating peerResults without checking if the host exists in the map
Potential deadlock in stopHealSequence due to infinite wait without timeout when waiting for heal sequence to end
Error handling issue in ServiceHandler where errors are logged but not returned to the client, potentially masking failures
